Package sps_p

Class ParameterKabpm

  • java.lang.Object
    • sps_p.Parameter
      • sps_p.ParameterKabpm
  • public class ParameterKabpm
extends Parameter
    Parameters are defined by using A, B, P, and M which is written in Kano's thesis(Mathematical Analysis for Non-reciprocal-interaction-based Model of Collective Behavior, 2017). Kij = { Ka (1 <= i <= 2/N, 1 <= j <= 2/N) Kp + Km (1 <= i <= 2/N, 2/N < j <= N) Kp - Km (2/N < j <= N, 1 <= j <= 2/N) Ka (2/N < j <= N, 2/N < j <= N) }

    • Method Detail

      • getGravity

        Pair<java.lang.Double> getGravity​(java.util.List<Particle> particles)
        Calculate the position of the center of gravity. rg = N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)ri
        Parameters:
        particles - The list of particles.
        Returns:
        The position of the center of gravity.

      • getX

        double getX​(java.util.List<Particle> particles)
        X = (N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)|ri - rg|)^(-1) rg = N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)ri rg denotes the position of the center of gravity. X converges to zero when at least one of the particles moves an infinite distance from the center of gravity.
        Parameters:
        particles - The list of particles.
        Returns:
        The reciprocal of the average of distance from the gravity.

      • getV

        double getV​(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Double>> timeEvolution,
            Pair<java.lang.Double> curG,
            Pair<java.lang.Double> nextG)
        V = N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)|ri(dot)-rg(dot)| V converges to zero when the relative velocities of all particles with respect to the center of gravity converge to zero.
        Parameters:
        timeEvolution - The list of the time evolution for each ri.
        curG - The position of the center of gravity in current step.
        nextG - The position of the center of gravity in next step.
        Returns:
        The average of relative speed with the gravity.

      • addPoint

        void addPoint​(double x,
              double v)
        X = (N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)|ri - rg|)^(-1), rg = N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)ri V = N^(-1) * Σ(N, i=1)|ri(dot)-rg(dot)| x = log10(10^3*X+1) y = log10(10^3*V+1)
        Parameters:
        x - The reciprocal of the average of distance from the gravity.
        v - The average of relative speed with the gravity.
